docs.lead_paragraph: CAMBRIDGE, Mass., May 10 -- About 40 kinds of "ordeal bean" and other plant-derived poisons were used by primitive societies to test accused offenders. If they survived, they were considered innocent.

headline.main: Plant-Derived Poisons Used In Treating Various Diseases

docs.abstract: symposium (Sullivan rept); 40 kinds of 'ordeal beans' and other plant-derived poisons, once used by primitive socs and now often used as med, discussed by Drs B Holmstedt and D Efron
docs.snippet: CAMBRIDGE, Mass., May 10 -- About 40 kinds of "ordeal bean" and other plant-derived poisons were used by primitive societies to test accused offenders. If they survived, they were considered innocent.

byline.original: By WALTER SULLIVANSpecial to The New York Times
